caption: –ö–æ–∂–Ω–æ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è –≤ —Å–≤—ñ—Ç—ñ –≤—ñ–¥–±—É–≤–∞—é—Ç—å—Å—è –Ω–µ–π–º–æ–≤—ñ—Ä–Ω–æ —à–≤–∏–¥–∫—ñ –∑–º—ñ–Ω–∏ –∫–ª—ñ–º–∞—Ç—É. –ê –º–∏ –¥—É–∂–µ –ø–æ–≤—ñ–ª—å–Ω–æ –ø–µ—Ä–µ—Ç–≤–æ—Ä—é—î–º–æ—Å—å –≤ –µ–∫–æ–ª–æ–≥—ñ—á–Ω–µ —Å—É—Å–ø—ñ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤–æ. –ú–∏ —á–∞—Å—Ç–æ –º–∏—Å–ª–∏–º–æ –≥–ª–æ–±–∞–ª—å–Ω–æ, –∞–ª–µ –º–∏ –∑–∞–±—É–≤–∞—î–º–æ —â–æ –º–∏ —á–∞—Å—Ç–∏–Ω–∞ —Ü—ñ–ª–æ—ó –ø–ª–∞–Ω–µ—Ç–∏. –Ø–∫—â–æ –∫–æ–∂–µ–Ω –∑ –Ω–∞—Å –∑–º—ñ–Ω–∏—Ç—å —Å–µ–±–µ –≤–∂–µ —ñ –∑–∞—Ä–∞–∑, —Å–≤—ñ—Ç –∑–º—ñ–Ω–∏—Ç—å—Å—è –≤ –º–æ–º–µ–Ω—Ç. –í –Ω–∞—Å —î –±–∞–≥–∞—Ç–æ –≥–ª–æ–±–∞–ª—å–Ω–∏—Ö –ø—Ä–æ–±–ª–µ–º, —è–∫—ñ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±—É—é—Ç—å –≤–∏—Ä—ñ—à–µ–Ω–Ω—è. –ê–ª–µ —î —ñ –¥—Ä—ñ–±–Ω—ñ, —è–∫—ñ –Ω–µ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±—É—é—Ç—å —á–∞—Å—É —ñ –º–æ–∂–ª–∏–≤–æ—Å—Ç–µ–π. –ü–µ—Ä—à–µ, –º–æ—è —Ä–æ–±–æ—Ç–∞ —Ü–µ —Å–∏–º–≤–æ–ª –≤–∏—Ö–æ–≤–∞–Ω–æ—ó " —Å–º—ñ—Ç—î–≤–æ—ó –∫—É–ª—å—Ç—É—Ä–∏" , —è–∫–∞ –Ω–µ —Ä–æ–∑–≤–∏–Ω–µ–Ω–∞ –≤ –Ω–∞—à–æ–º—É —Å—É—Å–ø—ñ–ª—å—Å—Ç–≤—ñ. –ü–æ–¥—Ä—É–≥–µ, —â–æ–± –ø–æ–±–∞—á–∏—Ç–∏ –ø–æ–≤–Ω—É –∫–∞—Ä—Ç–∏–Ω—É —Å—å–æ–≥–æ–¥–Ω—ñ—à–Ω—å–æ–≥–æ –¥–Ω—è –≤–∞–º –ø–æ—Ç—Ä—ñ–±–Ω–æ –Ω–∞—Ç–∏—Å–Ω—É—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞ —Ö–µ—à—Ç–µ–≥ . –ü–æ—Ç—Ä–µ—Ç—î, —Ñ–æ—Ç–æ –∑–∞–∫–∏–Ω—É—Ç–æ —É –¥–µ–Ω—å –¥–µ–¥–ª–∞–π–Ω—É, —Ç–æ–º—É —â–æ —è –≤–≤–∞–∂–∞—é, —â–æ –≤ –Ω–∞—Å –∫—Ä–∏—Ç–∏—á–Ω–∞ —Å—É–º–∞ —á–∞—Å—É, —â–æ–± –∑–º—ñ–Ω–∏—Ç–∏ –Ω–∞—à –≤–ø–ª–∏–≤ –Ω–∞ –ø—Ä–∏—Ä–æ–¥—É, —Ç–∞ –Ω–∞—Ä–µ—à—Ç—ñ —Å—Ç–∞—Ç–∏ –¥—Ä—É–∂–Ω—ñ–º–∏ –¥–æ –Ω–∞–≤–∫–æ–ª–∏—à–Ω—å–æ–≥–æ —Å–µ—Ä–µ–¥–æ–≤–∏—â–∞. –Ø –ø—ñ–¥—Ç—Ä–∏–º—É—é –∫–æ–Ω–∫—É—Ä—Å –≤—ñ–¥ @docudays_ua —Ç–æ–º—É , —â–æ –º–∏ –¥—ñ–π—Å–Ω–æ –ø–æ—Ç—Ä–µ–±—É—î–º —Ä—ñ—à—É—á–æ—ó —Ç–∞ —Å–ø—ñ–ª—å–Ω–æ—ó –ø—Ä–æ—Ç–∏–¥—ñ—ó, —â–æ —ñ —Å–∏–º–≤–æ–ª—ñ–∑—É—î –º–æ—î —Ñ–æ—Ç–æ. #ecooko #docudaysua #everydayclimatechange Every day the climate in the world is changing incredibly fast. We are very slowly transformed into an ecological society. We often think globally, but we forget that we are part of a planet. If each of us changes himself/herself now, the world will change in time. We have a lot of global problems that should be solved.But there are some small that do not require time and opportunities. Firstly, my work is a symbol of bred "trash culture" which is not developing in our society. Secondly, to see the full picture, you need to click on hashtag. Thirdly, the photo is exposed on the last day of deadline, that's why l think we haven't much time to change our impact on nature and become friendly to the environment . I support competition of @docudays_ua , because we really need a decisive and joint resistance . My photo is symbolizing that. Think globally, act locally. #ecooko #docudaysua #everydayclimatechange
tags: docudaysua, everydayclimatechange, ecooko

caption: I am a participant of @docudays_ua , because I believe in clean and ecological future of Ukraine. During the last two years I have cleaned my city Chernivtsi with "Let's do it Ukraine!". Of course, after this, it is so hard to see that someone is not able to carry the garbage to the trash that is 100 meters away.I believe that one day Ukraine will start using Switzerland's and Germany's experience in waste recycling and energy production. As for me, rubbish is one of the resources, that the world is seeking for .Unfortunately, these global thoughts do not change our culture. Why people allow themselves to throw glass on the street ,when the rubbish bins are side by side. I think that our strength is in joint actions. My photo is symbolizing that! caption: Thin sea ice, Baffin Bay, Canada, 2013 Arctic sea ice has been decreasing 13.3 percent per decade since the early 1980s. In September 2012, a new record of minimal sea ice extent was set: 1.31 million square miles (3.4 million square kilometers). In February 2015, at 5.61 million square miles (14.54 million square kilometers), a new record was set for its annual maximum winter extent. The sea ice in this photograph is thin, fragmented, first-year ice. Since temperatures are warming faster at the poles than anywhere else, the chance of thick, stable, multi-year ice forming in the future are decreasing. #witnesstreeproject #everydayclimatechange #ice #melt #winter #photography #arctic #canada #globalwarming #climate #climatechange #warm

caption: She lives downhill from one of the biggest frack pads in Ohio, dealing with the chemical air, constant noise and 30 day bouts of earth shaking as rock thousands of feet deep is fissured. She is a much needed voice in this rural community, speaking out and making known the injustices that run rampant. In her own words - "I'm certainly not an extreme environmentalist, and never was. What I am is a concerned landowner, a farmer who has had a connection with the earth for 40 years. And now my trees are dying, my waters no good, my animals have tumors on them, my grandson wakes up and can't breathe. Something's going on. I'm telling them. I'm telling these people you're all going to live in it eventually because it's expanding and getting bigger and bigger. We have to do something that is more sustainable than this. We can't kill our residents and our citizens."
tags: frackoff, climateaction, everydayclimatechange, climatechange, nopipelines, ohio

caption: Tonle Sap Lake, Cambodia. Photo by Paolo Patrizi @paolopatrizi for @everydayclimatechange Every year, the lake yields about 300,000 tons of fish, making it one of the world‚Äôs most productive freshwater ecosystems. That and the floods that pulse through it in monsoon season, swelling it to as much as five times its dry-season size, have earned the lake the nickname ‚ÄúCambodia‚Äôs beating heart.‚Äù But the Tonle Sap is in trouble ‚Äî from overfishing to feed a fast-growing population, from the cutting of mangrove forests that shelter young fish, from hydroelectric dams upstream, and from the dry seasons that are expected to grow hotter and longer with climate change. Climate models forecast longer, hotter dry seasons for Southeast Asia, and more intense monsoon floods. Both changes could disrupt the migration and spawning patterns of Tonle Sap fish. #everydayclimatechange #climatechange #climatechangeisreal #globalwarming #everydayeverywhere
tags: everydayclimatechange, climatechangeisreal, globalwarming, everydayeverywhere, climatechange

caption: Photo by Ashley Crowther @ashleycrowtherorg for @everydayclimatechange: The Himalayas, where many consider them to be untouched paradise, but outside ideas and perceptions count for little when one digs under the surface. Climate change is severely impacting the highest mountain range on earth changing rain and snowfall patterns and warming the region up. Droughts have become endemic, and there is now a continual worry throughout villages located in the mountains about constant water shortages. Pictured is, Kunga, a local of the Spiti Valley, India, as he assesses the villages completely dried primary water storage dam. Successive years without adequate winter snowfall has seen most springs dry up before summers end as they simply cannot recharge. Water is a crucial resource at any time of the year in the Himalayas, but especially in the summer crop-growing season. In 2016 Summer, Kunga told me that due to severe water shortages their main cash crop, green peas were slashed by almost three-quarters, which cut his and the village's incomes drastically. In December 2016 I sent Kunga a message asking if snow had fallen yet. He replied with ‚ÄúMaybe in January‚Ä¶‚Äù #everydayclimatechange #climatechange #climatechangeisreal #globalwarming #everydayeverywhere
tags: everydayclimatechange, climatechangeisreal, globalwarming, everydayeverywhere, climatechange

caption: Near my aunt and uncle‚Äôs house in central Texas, lie the remnants of a bridge that was swept away in the May 2015 flooding that submerged downtown Austin and other parts of central Texas, and resulted in multiple fatalities. caption: Spent a week in the high Himalayan mountain desert of Ladakh working with a team that builds artificial glaciers. With receding natural glaciers that fail to feed agricultural fields in spring season, these tall structures will provide relief to the farmers in the future and help in turning Ladakh green! caption: Children participated to Day in a brigade collecting the trash of the community of Agua Caliente Jalisco state, western Mexico. Researchers from the Guadalajara University Center of Health Sciences presented a study showing high levels of heavy metals in the urine of local inhabitants - approximately 50 percent of those examined have kidney damage - in the community of Agua Caliente on the banks of Lake Chapala. The researchers plan to continue working to determine the cause of the record levels of pollution. #photojournalist #everydayclimatechange
tags: photojournalist, everydayclimatechange

caption: Two boys play inside a #Samoan fale (or house) at dusk. Electricity came to this island in 1972 but at a high cost, both financially and culturally. Now, the island of Ta'u is slowly shifting back into a mindset of sustainability, starting with a solar energy microgrid from @SolarCity and @Tesla that will offset over 100k gallons of diesel fuel each year. See the full story at @natgeo (Link in bio). . . . #solarpower #documentaryphotography #solarpanels #climatechange #everydayclimatechange #samoan #sustainableliving @everydayclimatechange

caption: @cirebongogreen Di Indonesia volume sampah mengalami peningkatan seiring dengan pertambahan penduduk, penanganan sampah pun harus maximal memgingat perilaku masyarakat yang belum mempedulikan sampah rumah tangganya. Perilaku sosial tersebut diprediksi berasal dari persepsi masyarakat yang menganggap sampah sebagai barang kotor, tidak berharga, tidak bermanfaat, dan tidak mempunyai nilai ekonomi. Persepsi tersebut mendorong masyarakat untuk mencari cara yang paling mudah dan murah dalam menangani sampah rumah tangganya yaitu dengan membuang atau membakarnya. menurut kami, itu bukan satu satunya solusi karena kita dapat mereduksinya R3 , reduce, reuse, recycle .... monggo yg berminat belajar tentang kelola sampah bisa ke " SAKOLA SAMPAH" Sanggar LH cirebon. ada berbagai macam edukasi tentang lingkungan. seperti tampak pada gambar, siswa siswi dr SMAN 1 Plumbon kab cirebon. yang merupakan sekolah binaan SLH sudah memulai mengelola sampah disekolahnya. . . . üì∑: diambil saat hari peduli sampah 2017 ,21 februari di sman 1 plumbon ______________________________ info lebih lanjut dapat menghubungi kontak pada bio kami #cirebongogreen #cirebonBISA #sanggarLHcirebon #Reduse #reuse #recycle #HPSN2017 #haripedulisampah #environment #everydayclimatechange #cirebonbebaspenyampah2022 #cirebon #jendelacirebon #cirebonmilikbersama #janganrusakcirebon

caption: Photo by Amnon Gutman @gutmanen for #everydayclimatechange. Members of the Nasa tribe playing soccer, on a hilltop patch of land. The Nasa are a native American people who live for the most part in the Northern parts of Cauca Department of Colombia, territory desired by the different warring parties for the control and development of cash crops. Colombia is at high risk from climate change impacts. The majority of the population lives in the elevated Andes, where water shortages and land instability are already a reality, and on the coast, where the increase in sea level and floods can affect key human settlements and economic activities. Furthermore, the country has a high incidence of extreme events with growing emergencies associated with climate conditions. Colombia has made strides in the attainment of the MDGs. However, these goals are still fragile and marked by a scenario burdened with social conflicts teeming with regional inequalities and social gaps, including a high percentage of vulnerable populations that may suffer serious setbacks in their human development due precisely to climate change. The climate scenarios presented in Colombia's Second National Communication on Climate Change, predict an increase in the average temperature between 2¬∞ and 4¬∞ C by 2070, along with changed hydrological conditions. #climatechange #globalwarming #climatechangecolombia
tags: climatechangecolombia, globalwarming, everydayclimatechange, climatechange

caption: The savannas, swamps, and forests of Kenya‚Äôs South Rift Valley are home to traditional pastoral people and their livestock as well as an abundance of wildlife but severe drought is disasterously affecting this area as in other regions across East Africa. Traditional systems and coping mechanisms such as migrating along grazing pastures have broken down with people not leaving the Ewaso Nyiro river settlements as usual. Herds are being taken far into Tanzania, others north into the Maasai Mara. The culminating effects of large numbers of stock on the land, high dependence on these stock, and cumulative droughts are taking a high toll not only on the people of Kenya's South Rift but on the environment. Understated are the social repercussions of drought which cause high levels of stress within the community, bitterness and anger, increasing poverty and even in some cases suicide. Education of pastoralist children suffers making their future more difficult and uncertain. What has become clear is maintaining key drought refuges like swamps and woodlands are a key conservation priority. It may seem that pastoralism is at a transformational crossroads. Source: South Rift: Communities, Conservation, and Research http://southriftccr.blogspot.co.ke/2010/01/comparing-drought-situation-across.html by Samantha Russell #climatechange #globalwarming @everydayclimatechange #everydayclimatechange #Masai #windowtotheworld #water #visualsoflife #environment #desert #desertification #toldwithexposure #makemoments #followmetoo #acertainslantoflight #climatechangeisreal @natgeo #natgeo #reframeclimate #dust #canon #canon5dmarkIII @gettyreportage #gettyreportage #whpcolourful
tags: windowtotheworld, natgeo, toldwithexposure, acertainslantoflight, climatechangeisreal, masai, desertification, dust, everydayclimatechange, canon, water, climatechange, visualsoflife, environment, whpcolourful, followmetoo, gettyreportage, canon5dmarkiii, makemoments, globalwarming, desert, reframeclimate

Traditional systems and coping mechanisms such as migrating along grazing pastures have broken down with people not leaving the Ewaso Nyiro river settlements as usual. Herds are being taken far into Tanzania, others north into the Maasai Mara. The culminating effects of large numbers of stock on the land, high dependence on these stock, and cumulative droughts are taking a high toll not only on the people of Kenya's South Rift but on the environment. Understated are the social repercussions of drought which cause high levels of stress within the community, bitterness and anger, increasing poverty and even in some cases suicide. Education of pastoralist children suffers making their future more difficult and uncertain. What has become clear is maintaining key drought refuges like swamps and woodlands are a key conservation priority. It may seem that pastoralism is at a transformational crossroads. Source: South Rift: Communities, Conservation, and Research http://southriftccr.blogspot.co.ke/2010/01/comparing-drought-situation-across.html by Samantha Russell #climatechange #globalwarming #everydayclimatechange #Masai #windowtotheworld #water #visualsoflife #environment #desert #desertification #toldwithexposure #makemoments #followmetoo #acertainslantoflight #climatechangeisreal @natgeo #natgeo #reframeclimate #dust #canon #canon5dmarkIII @gettyreportage #gettyreportage #whpcolourful

caption: What struck me most after spending several months working in South Sudan is just how much potential the country has (at least in terms of agriculture), and although not surprising it‚Äôs heart-breaking to learn that famine was declared in parts What struck me most after spending several months working in South Sudan is just how much potential the country has (at least in terms of agriculture), and although not surprising it‚Äôs heart-breaking to learn that famine was declared in parts of the country this week. Fifty percent of the country‚Äôs land is arable, but only four percent is cultivated at any one time. I witnessed men sit around playing dominoes while their wives work themselves to death trying to make ends meet. Inflation of food prices broke world records, yet surplus eggplants sell for next to nothing because people don't know how to eat them. People can barely feed themselves in more peaceful areas, let alone in areas affected by conflict. Sadly, war and food insecurity is nothing new for the South Sudanese, it‚Äôs something they‚Äôve endured for decades, only now it‚Äôs being made so much worse by the added pressures of climate change, depleting resources and the economic crises. I didn't interview that many elderly people as life expectancy isn't very high in South Sudan but when I came across an elderly person whose memory was intact, it was fascinating listening to their stories about war coming to the region, family, survival and climate change. This wasn‚Äôt someone I‚Äôd planned on interviewing but he wanted to talk, so we listened: "From the time I was young until the time I got married, I was alive. White people came during that time. Then when I grew up, the white people left and the Arabs came. The Arabs came with fighting. No cows, no goats, just war. It is the Arabs who made us like this, they showed us something very bad, they showed us killing. I know this from when I was young, up until now. This is what I have in my heart. Me, I cut the grass then I put it on my house... www.bit.ly/2lFxm7k (cont reading) #southsudan #famine #africa #everydayclimatechange #climatechange #conflict #portrait #drought #flood
tags: southsudan, famine, flood, conflict, portrait, everydayclimatechange, climatechange, africa, drought

caption: Singrauli, Madhya Pradesh, was once covered with dense and unnavigable forests that were inhabited by the wildest animals. The place was considered so treacherous that it was used by the kings of Rewa State, who ruled the area till 1947, as an open air prison for detaining errant civilians and officers. Now sections near the coal mines and power plants remain barren with simply mounds and mounds of mining waste heaped on like hillocks. The land is overly excavated, there is dust in the air and all you hear is dozers hauling rocks and sirens around. The villagers, who are inherently farmers, try to make ends meet in whichever way possible, be it collecting pieces of coal after scavenging through the mining dumps and then selling it for some token money. Seen here, a villager carrying a jute bag of coal from the mining dumpsite to the market for sale. Dispatch from reporting on the ground from Singrauli, Madhya Pradesh, India with photographer @sidharthvhavle. #onassignment #india #justice #guardianseries
tags: guardianseries, onassignment, ruralindia, india, everydayclimatechange, justice

caption: Photo by Georgina Goodwin @ggkenya for @everydayclimatechange. The world's attention is increasingly being brought to what is now commonly called global warming, which most scientists say is caused by carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gas emissions largely coming from rich countries. But experts say deforestation in developing countries such as those in Africa also exacerbates the effects of climate change. The country has lost more than 8% of its forest cover since 1963. Today, Kenya is among countries of the world with a forest cover of less than 2% of total land mass. One of the main contributing factors is human activities like logging, cutting for firewood and charcoal burning, and encroachment of forestland all of which continue under the eyes of Kenya Forest Services and other government agencies who do not appreciate the need for a green economy. The government is very much aware of the ongoing deforestation in the country, but with polluted politics, a burgeoning population with 42.4% being children under 15 (according to 2015 census), many of whom live on a less than a dollar a day, the hope to save our forests seems to be fading every day. . . #climatechange #globalwarming #everydayclimatechange #forests #windowtotheworld #trees #poverty #environment #rural #vscokenya #igkenya #childrenoftheworld #makeportraitsnotwar #deforestation #toldwithexposure #visualsoflife #followmetoo #justbackfrom #climatechangeisreal @natgeo #natgeo #reframeclimate #canon #canon5dmarkIII ‚Ñ¢ @everydayclimatechange #climatechangeimpact #actonclimate

caption: Oyster hatching tanks, Whiskey Creek Fish Hatchery, Tillamook, Oregon, USA, 2011 The oceans absorb about 30 percent of all carbon dioxide that humans put into the atmosphere causing the water to become more acidic. This lack of pH balance affects many forms of marine life including oysters whose shells have a difficult time forming in water that has too much bicarbonate and not enough carbonate ions. Oyster production for hatcheries like Whiskey Creek declined 80 percent in 2009 due to ocean acidification. #witnesstreeproject #environment #ocean #water #acid #acidic #atmosphere #climatechange #globalwarming #everydayclimatechange #oyster #oregon #warm #shell #life #planet #earth #nature #change #art #photography

caption: #Repost @everydayclimatechange with @repostapp „Éª„Éª„Éª Guest Post: Photo by Samantha Q. Lawrence @samaqlama for @everydayclimatechange Before 1940, you never would have seen these magical "glacial diamonds" washed up on Iceland's shore. Vatnaj√∂kull glacier was so big that it stretched from the land to meet the edge of the sea. Now, it has receded so dramatically that what we see is a glacier lagoon, a melted pool of the remnants of Vatnaj√∂kull, where huge chunks of ice break off and are swept out to the ocean. It is a sight to behold, but it is not a sight to forget. If we don't make an effort to stop climate change then Vatnaj√∂kull will be gone forever. #climatechange #iceland#brei√∞amerkurj√∂kull #climatechange#everydayclimatechange#globalwarming #glacier #risingseas#globalclimatechange #climate #nature#diamondbeach #vatnaj√∂kull#j√∂kuls√°rl√≥n #glacierlagoon #landscape#cleanenergy #environment#conservation #ice #beforetheflood#mystopover #takeaction

caption: This Exxon refinery in western Baton Rouge, one of the largest in the country, is surrounded by residential neighborhoods. It was the subject of an extended NPR piece in 2013, which highlighted the possible health impacts of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) used in oil refining, and also exposed the persistent underreporting of VOC emissions by oil refiners. As is often the case with heavily polluting industries, the neighborhoods surrounding the Baton Rouge refinery are disproportionately made up of low-income communities and communities of color, highlighting the need for community self-determination on environmental issues. The Movement for Black Lives calls this ongoing inequity ‚Äúenvironmental racism‚Äù, and argues that it ‚Äúis largely a result of our dispossession and lack of control over land, resources, and decision making abilities in our communities." Cycling the world, telling the human story of climate change. #climate #climatechange #fossilfuels #renewables #renewableenergy #renewablefuture #cycling #bicycling #biking #worldbybike #cycletouring #bicycletouring #activetransport #hesterthebike #travel #travelphotography #landscape #nikon #everydayclimatechange #blm #blacklives #m4bl

caption: Photo by @JshPhotog - Visitors to Whitelee Wind Farm, outside Glasgow, Scotland, examine a blade from a wind turbine. This wind farm has 215 turbines, making it the largest onshore wind farm in the UK, and the 2nd largest in Europe (the largest is in Romania). The turbine blade pictured is 40metres long, and when traveling at maximum speed, a turbine‚Äôs blade‚Äôs tips can travels at speeds of up to 240kmph. A light breeze of 3.5metres per second is enough to turn a turbine, but optimum peak output is reached with wind speeds of around 13metres per second, equivalent to a strong gale. This wind farm harnesses the power of the winds coming off of the North Atlantic, making the infamous Scottish weather a great source of renewable and sustainable energy, helping the country to cut climate-wrecking greenhouse gas emissions from fossil fuel usage. #ClimateChange #WhiteleeWindFarm #JeremySuttonHibbert #WindPower #energy #renewables #Glasgow #Scotland #EverydayClimateChange

caption: An innovative way to stop deforestation is to write the name of a God on its bark. In this case, it's written as 'RAM', the legendary character of Hindu mythological story, Ramayan. Prohibiting deforestation is very important especially if it's a flood devastated region like Majuli. In three decade, Majuli reduced to 400sqkm from a massive 1200sq km area due to devastating flood. caption: A protest for the right to water in Malad, Mumbai, by the residents of Ambujwadi, an informal settlement. Organized by grassroots movement Ghar Bachao Ghar Banao, thousands of mostly women carried empty water pots to surround the municipal office. On the 28th of July 2010, the General Assembly of the United Nations, recognized access to clean water and sanitation as a human right, with a vote of 121 nations voting for the resolution, with none voting against, along with 41 abstentions. India voted for water as a human right. Meanwhile the municipal authorities of Mumbai deprive hundreds of informal settlements of water, leaving them at the mercy of mafias. #Mumbai #EverydayMumbai Photo @moondynamite
tags: everydaymumbai, mumbai

caption: Great message from @everydayclimatechange with Photo by Georgina Goodwin @ggkenya - The world's attention is increasingly being brought to what is now commonly called global warming, which most scientists say is caused by carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gas emissions largely coming from rich countries. But experts say deforestation in developing countries such as those in Africa also exacerbates the effects of climate change. The country has lost more than 8% of its forest cover since 1963. Today, Kenya is among countries of the world with a forest cover of less than 2% of total land mass. One of the main contributing factors is human activities like logging, cutting for firewood and charcoal burning, and encroachment of forestland all of which continue under the eyes of Kenya Forest Services and other government agencies who do not appreciate the need for a green economy. The government is very much aware of the ongoing deforestation in the country, but with polluted politics, a burgeoning population with 42.4% being children under 15 (according to 2015 census), many of whom live on a less than a dollar a day, the hope to save our forests seems to be fading every day. . . #carefornature
tags: carefornature

caption: Shehnaz came here to work when she was 18 and since then she and all her family members have been working in the waste sector. Today, she is working on the banks of Mithi river adjoining Dharavi where she segregates plastic waste and sells it to plastic recyclers in Dharavi. Her husband died on the job 3 months back and now her son works with her. She has a daughter too who takes care of the household work. She says it is getting tougher for her and other plastic waste workers as she is earning 4-5 rupees per gunny bag she sells, compared to 8-10 rupees a couple of years ago. She has high hopes from the upcoming Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections and is taking an off from work to support her political party. She will lose a day's wage but if her candidate wins, the prices of plastic waste will again go up (as promised by the candidate) according to her. #everydaymumbai #everydayclimatechange Photo @rohitpixel
tags: everydaymumbai, everydayclimatechange

caption: "Le Gardien" Marbre noir Golzinne de Belgique/Acier thermolaqu√©. Black marble Golzinne from Belgium/Thermolacquered steel. . "L'homme se doit d'√™tre le gardien de la nature, non son propri√©taire. Tant que notre civilisation mat√©rialiste donnera au milieu naturel une grande valeur lorsqu'il est d√©truit, une valeur faible ou nulle lorsqu'il est sauvegard√©, comment s'√©tonner qu'il disparaisse? Le co√ªt de la protection du milieu naturel est beaucoup plus faible que le co√ªt de sa reconstitution. La d√©fense de la nature est rentable pour la nation." . "Man should be the keeper of Nature, not its owner. As long as our materialistic civilization will endow the natural environment with a greater value when destroyed, a far lesser one - or no one at all -when kept safe, no surprise it disappears. Protecting Nature is much cheaper than regenerating it. Nature conservation is profitable to nations." . Philippe St Marc / Socialisation de la Nature #art#marbre#marble#marmo#sculpture#tailledirecte#directcarving#artist#fineart#ecology#ecologie#artcontemporain#contemporaryart#fineartist#artwork#artlovers#sculptor#savoirfaire#handmade#madeinfrance#arbre#tree#climatechange#everydayclimatechange

caption: Test tubes of oyster larvae at Whiskey Creek Shellfish Hatchery, Tillamook, Oregon, USA, 2011 In the mid-2000s, hatcheries like Whiskey Creek started noticing a large die-off of their oyster larvae. At first it was thought it was due to a bacteria (vibrio tubiashii) that had caused other recent die-offs, but Richard Feely a NOAA scientist (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration) proved that ocean acidification was the culprit. #witnesstreeproject #climatechange #environment #oregon #shellfish #whiskeycreek #noaa #everydayclimatechange #atmosphere #environmental #globalwarming #ocean #water #save #earth #planet #science #scientist

caption: Having stayed in Bangalore for more than a decade now, I call this city my second home. Of the many memories that I've of this city, one, for sure, is of the weather. Not that I complain of it now, but it surely isn't the same it used to be till a few years ago. I still remember walking 4 to 5 kilometres everyday in Jayanagar 4th Block or 7th Block area with grand, green canopy naturally formed by the trees that dotted the area. It's all gone now. Gone are the birds that once sought shelter in those trees and gone is the weather. #iphoneonly #everydayindia #everydayeverywhere #everydayclimatechange #bangaloreweather #planttrees #goodmorning #photooftheday #instadaily #thebest_capture #instagram

caption: Last bits of snow in the Slovakian High Tatras in August 2015. Despite of the beautiful winter and snow we have this season, we should not forget that global warming is real. Living in the 21st century, knowing so much about the globe, the universe, about our existence. No one should doubt the scientific evidences of our effect on the life of the planet.

Climate Change in Bangladesh ~ A children stand in front of broken house the village of Patharghata the Barguna District area on 21 November 2007 in Bangladesh. Cyclone Sidr, reaching top speeds of almost 240 km per hour, hits the coastal district of Bangladesh, devastating the country's southwest and southern costal areas, including the Sunderbans, and killing thousands. The cyclone leaves its mark of devastation on 130 upazilas, 710 unions, affecting almost 3 million people.Climate Change is my long-term project where I began to document of marginal condition in my own country of Bangladesh. My investigation finally brought me to a climate refugee in Bangladesh.¬© Monirul Alam #climatechange#globalwarming#everydayclimatechange#photojournalism#bangladesh#dailylife#erosion#drought#flood#yourshotphotographer#reportagespotlight#opensocietyfoundations#lensculture#longtermproject#documentary#CycloneSidr#food#disaster#villager

caption: I recently developed my film from the last 4 and a half months of travel in Patagonia and will be sharing some of those photographs, as well as some of the photographs from my first trip to Patagonia back in April, beginning here with the southern most point of South America on the island of Tierra del Fuego, also known as "The End of the World." Although the town of Ushuaia has become a touristy destination and the prices of everything are sky high, it is worth the trip, as it still carries a wonderful feeling of isolation and being far, far away from the rest of the world--which can inspire in one an incredible sense of freedom. It is that freedom that kept me in Patagonia far longer than I had planned, and will have me coming back for the rest of my life. _ This photograph is looking back at the trail leading to Laguna Esmeralda, a beautiful light blue colored laguna surrounded by jagged peaked mountains topped by a glacier. The path took several hours as it was a rainy day and the trail was covered almost entirely in mud and turba, a spongey plant covering the ground that sinks as you step on it. When we arrived at the laguna, we took off our boots and socks, folded up our pants, walked into the freezing cold laguna, and remained in the water until we were overcome with the feeling of a thousand little spikes poking our legs. To immerse oneself in such freezing temperatures is a jolting experience that I like to do at every body of glacier water I come across. For me, it is a way to pay my respects to the glaciers, which we have been sadly destroying every single day. At another glacier outside Ushuaia, there were beautiful caves that we could enter, filled with a mesmerizing blue light. But those caves were formed by the glacier's melting, and we were surrounded by the constant dripping sound of the glacier's weeping. #35mm #film _ _ #ushuaia #argentina #tierradelfuego #lagunaesmeralda #everydaylatinamerica #everydayclimatechange #glacier #35mmfilm #documentary #streetphotography #lensculture #filmcommunity #southamerica #patagonia #shootfilm
tags: documentary, everydayclimatechange, lensculture, filmcommunity, glacier, 35mm, ushuaia, streetphotography, everydaylatinamerica, patagonia, argentina, tierradelfuego, film, lagunaesmeralda, shootfilm, southamerica, 35mmfilm

caption: Women draw water from a well, which has long since gone dry but is replenished once a day with water from tankers, at Karigaon in Beed, Maharshtra, India. March 25, 2016. Pleased to receive an honourable mention at this year's Imagely Fund grant for my work on drought and agrarian crisis in the Marathwada region of Maharashtra, India. Happy to report the region has received good rainfall this year and hope the resilient people of Marathwada don't have to suffer much in the coming summer months. #india #climatechange #environment #water #drought #maharashtra #marathwada #marathwadadrought #everydayclimatechange #everydayindia #agrariancrisis #agriculture #raiyatnama

The Senate has put the short term coorporate financial gains of polluters before our rights to access clean water and air. Protecting the environment is now up to all of us. caption: Woke up to a northern valley without snow. It rained last night and the land smells of #spring, two months too early. I think of the bear den down in hills, the one I stumbled upon in the fall, and wonder if the snowmelt is pooling where the bear lays, maybe with her cubs. Will she stir early this year? Climate change has thrown everything out of whack. Will the crocuses blossom early this year? Are the geese already on their way back to the north? If we lose our snowmelt, too quickly, before the trees open their moist leaves, will the forests become kindling? Is the fire season already upon us? The land signals that winter is becoming a lost season. The snowpack is a vital source of ground moisture in the #boreal. I do not look upon nature this morning and feel at #peace: I feel worried for this changing landscape; for the bear in her den below, for the land that should be covered in snow. #photography #landscapes #climatechange #peaceriver #mightypeace #north #land #winter #change #globalwarming #spring #geese #bears #conservation #observations #listentonature #heartriver #fire #fireseason #desertification #canada #alberta #politics #everydayclimatechange @everydayclimatechange
tags: alberta, globalwarming, everydayclimatechange, climatechange, politics, fire, heartriver, photography, landscapes, spring, change, bears, fireseason, peaceriver, winter, listentonature, canada, conservation, land, geese, north, mightypeace, boreal, peace, desertification, observations

caption: For the #Blink takeover, VII Photo's (@viiphoto) Ed Kashi (@edkashi) is sharing work from Everyday Climate Change (@everydayclimatechange) Pictured are #laborers preparing the #Marakannam salt pan fields for salt harvest near #Pondicherry, #India on Jan. 21, 2016. Thousands of laborers in this part of India are getting sick with Chronic Kidney Disease (#CKDnT). This disease prevents them from working and in many cases results in death. #Dehydration and severe heat exposure are believed to be the leading causes of CKDnT. Rising temperatures and changing precipitation patterns in southern India are making working conditions for agricultural laborers even more perilous as CKDnT wreaks havoc on individuals, families, and communities. The people who are most exposed to the effects of #climatechange are those who are already vulnerable. #everydayclimatechange #climatechangeisreal #climate #globalwarming #CKD #CKDu #chronickidneydisease #actonclimate
tags: globalwarming, everydayclimatechange, marakannam, climatechange, actonclimate, climatechangeisreal, india, laborers, climate, dehydration, ckdu, ckdnt, pondicherry, ckd, blink, chronickidneydisease

caption: Jabiru Reserve Its been over 12 months now since I've seen a Black-necked stork commonly known as a Jabiru. A phone call from my sister in-law alerted me to one on the lake. A rare sighting at what is officially known as Jabiru Reserve. #jabiru #blackneckedstork #animal_sultans #birdsofaustralia #birdfreaks #bird_brilliance #canonaustralia #everydayclimatechange #everythinganimals #wow_australia2017

caption: A fortnight after the Dawn Kanchipuram spilt an estimated 75 tonnes of bunker oil ‚Äî a heavy petroleum residue used to start ship engines ‚Äî port authorities are yet to explain how two enormous tankers, each freighted with inflammable hydrocarbons, could collide three kilometres off the Chennai coastline. On January 28, 2017, two ships collided outside the Kamarajar Port Ltd in Ennore leading to a massive oil spill that has affected more than 45 km of Chennai‚Äôs coastline. The company‚Äôs first response was to deny any damage to the environment, and it went ahead to ensure that the situation was being monitored by all top officials at the port. caption: I request üôè u to read this @raghavjuyal . The major threat to earth is from us. We human beings with such intellect, are unable to grasp that we are killing our mother nature for our living. The rate at which our population is increasing and the rate at which we are consuming natural resources are so bad that eventually earth will lose its ability to sustain life. In the name of house, borewell, etc we dig earth deep creating an imbalance in its crust, cut its trees, creating an imbalance in wind and atmosphere. In the name of comfort or ease of traveling, we pollute its atmosphere. In the name of cleanliness we throw garbage into the seas making the water impure. It's time we realize the fact that we need to take care of our mother nature. We shouldn't kill our planet for our living. We are the destructors of this planet. Just realize that even if we lived forever we have to live on this planet. We have nowhere else to go. Start nurturing the planet just as you nurture your body. Because your sustenance requires that the earth is hale and hearty. . -Save Earth: There‚Äôs no place like home . #raghavjuyal #savenature #saveearth #saveenviornment #saveanimals #gogreen #everydayclimatechange #stopgloblewarming üôèüôè

caption: "Slums of Mumbai, India. Energy puts on an incredible show at night and reminds you that millions of people are alive, surviving, and going through the daily grind. So much of our energy is sourced from fossil fuels that are responsible for vast amounts of air pollution and CO2 emissions that cause climate change. However, fossil fuels have been and still are responsible for the development of billions of people worldwide. There is no other source of concentrated energy that is so cheap, accessible, and transportable. This is why it is so important that global leaders take into consideration multiple solutions and adaptations to wean our society off our fossil fuel addiction. If people are to be lifted out of poverty, alternative energy sources need to be just as cheap and accessible. Subsidies play a large part in this game, and there is a dire need to shift subsidies away from fossil fuels to clean energy sources. Energy is a central factor to the betterment of people's lives. Without it nothing is possible. . #everydayclimatechange #climatechange #globalwarming #climatechangeisreal #everydaymumbai #everydayindia #mumbai #india Photo @ashleycrowtherorg / @everydayclimatechange "
tags: globalwarming, climatechange, mumbai, everydaymumbai, climatechangeisreal, everydayclimatechange, india, everydayindia

Two brothers taking a break from wildfire cleanup, East Bastrop, Texas, USA, 2011 Despite idyllic street names such as Peace Haven and Kingdom Path Lane, there was little to soothe the minds and hearts of the more than 1,500 families who lost their homes to wildfires in this small town east of Austin, Texas. caption: How are you planning on traveling this holiday ? . . . Traffic on the Brooklyn Queens Expressway, Brooklyn, New York, USA, 2015 According to the U.S. Department of Transportation, 28 percent of all greenhouse gas emissions in the U.S. are created from the burning of fossil fuels for transportation. This number does not include the emissions created from the production of fuel and vehicles. A typical passenger car emits approximately 20 pounds (8,887 grams) of carbon dioxide from one gallon (3.7 liters) of gasoline resulting in 10,362 pounds (4.7 metric tons) of CO2 over the course of a year #witnesstreeproject #climatechange #pollution #traffic #globalwarming #greehousegases #holidays #travel #highway #ny #newyork #nyc #brooklyn #bqe #christmas #endofyear #planet #earth #everydayclimatechange

The best works will be chosen to be printed for the exhibition at Docudays UA 2017. For detailed information you can find in profile @docudays_ua // My photo is about the problem of deforestation. Forests still cover about 30 percent of the world‚Äôs land area, but half the size of England is lost each year. caption: This week I will be sharing information about the great barrier reef across my social media platforms. Follow me on Twitter and Facebook to learn more. . . . . Sea turtle, Great Barrier Reef, Australia, 2012 Sea turtles are impacted by climate change in several ways: rising seas are taking away their nesting grounds; hatchlings born in higher temperatures are weaker and struggle to swim safely into the ocean; and since temperatures above 86 degrees Fahrenheit (30 degrees Celsius)produce females, some scientists predict that a mean global temperature increase of 7.2 Fahrenheit (4.8 degrees Celsius) has the potential to eliminate male offspring #witnesstreeproject #turtle #sea #greatbarrierreef #reef #environment #globalwarming #climatechange #water #animals #earth #protection #damage #change #art #photography #instagram #project #everydayclimatechange

caption: Unhealthy coral reef, Great Barrier Reef, Australia, 2012 In the Great Barrier Reef, an increase of coral-eating crown-of-thorn starfish are responsible for nearly 50% of coral loss. Scientists from the Australian Institute of Marine Science discovered that a 2 degree Celsius (3.6 degrees F) increase in ocean temperatures more than triples the survival rate of the starfish larvae, giving them an advantage over already stressed coral populations. #witnesstreeproject #coral #greatbarrierreef #water #ocean #oceans #environment #globalwarming #climatechange #planet #earth #underwater #coralreef #reef #australia #starfish #temperature #heat #stress #everydayclimatechange

caption: Rough surf and pier, Palm Beach, Florida, USA, 2013 A 2014 article in Florida‚Äôs Sun Sentinel newspaper noted that since Palm Beach County stands 15 feet above sea level, it might avoid the worst impacts of impending sea level rise. A one-foot rise might bring permanent flooding to less than one square mile of Palm Beach‚Äôs barrier islands, but according to Dr. Hal Wanless, chairman of the Geological Sciences Department of the University of Miami, ‚ÄúIt would turn Broward County [to the south] into a wetland.‚Äù During storm surges and ‚Äúking-tides‚Äù Palm Beach can already get a feel for what might also be in store for them. #witnesstreeproject #environment #climatechange #climate #water #florida #palmbeach #sea #seawater #ocean #risk #beach #miami #geology #surf #beaches #barrier #science #future #planet #earth #natutr #flood #flooding #floodwater #everydayclimatechange

Birds flying over drought-struck cornfield, Urbana, Illinois, USA, 2012 According to Bob Linke, an Illinois family farmer, the land around Champaign-Urbana is considered to be ‚Äúclass A‚Äù or some of the best in the world. But during the Central Plains drought in 2012, the quality of the land didn‚Äôt matter when there was so little rain to water the fields. #witnesstreeproject #drought #illinois #birds #field #water #dry #farm #farmland #corn #plains #field #fields #10000gallonsaday #save #environment #planet #earth #nature #conservation #conserve #everydayclimatechange

caption: It's amazing what can happen when people come together to create change. Today, hundreds of thousands of people will unite across the country to support the Women's March on Washington‚Äã and it reminds me of the powerful People's Climate March‚Äã in 2014 in NYC. . . . . Penguins at the People‚Äôs Climate March, New York, New York, 2014 On September 21, 2014, approximately 400,000 people gathered in New York City to demand that world leaders take action to end the climate crisis. While the march was happening in New York, another 2,645 events were held in solidarity in over 150 other countries around the world. #witnesstreeproject #climate #climatechange #penguin #nyc #newyork #march #activism #people #change #globalwarming #hot #earth #planet #document #photography #environment #environmentalism #everydayclimatechange

caption: An issue like climate change can feel like a daunting battle for one person to take on. But it's not about how big of an impact you make, it's about putting in the effort. If we all did something small on a regular basis like Ruby Molinari of the Force Majeure Project above we can make a difference. . . . . . . Ruby Molinari preparing plants for a Force Majeure project, Sagehen Creek Field Station, Truckee, California, USA, 2014 Force Majeure is a study center created in 2007 by American land artists Helen and Newton Harrison in response to global warming. Their project at Sagehen involved planting seedlings at various altitudes to see which will survive our changing climatic conditions. #thewitnesstreeproject #environment #activism #activist #environmentalism #solutions #change #earth #world #climatechange #globalwarming #planetearth #help #impact #getinvolved #art #photography #photo #instagram #everydayclimatechange

caption: Here is another example of small things you can do in your everyday life to help make an impact on your local community. A good Samaritan cleans up Tom Nevers' beach, Nantucket, MA, 2014 This resident told me that whenever she comes to the beach to walk her dog she always brings a bag to clean up garbage that has been left behind or washed up on the shore. Like the woman in Nairobi repurposing plastic bags, I was encouraged by her personal efforts to do something for her local community. #witnesstreeproject #environment #environmental #beach #help #nantucket #massachussetts #newengland #cleanup #localactivism #activism #community #photography #instagram #beaches #plastic #plasticbags #helping #everydayclimatechange

caption: Last week the National Parks Foundation team members across the country continued to push out information about climate change to the American Public despite being told to stay quiet. These individuals protect the beauty of the country that is rapidly being affected by global warming. Continue to support National Parks Foundation by donating to them now (link on my Facebook page and Twitter). . . . . . Welcome brochure, Pond Inlet, Canada, 2013 When I asked Canadian park ranger Pauline Scott about the effects of climate change around Pond Inlet she easily noted a long list of impacts: the obvious shrinking of the glaciers in Sirmilik National Park; the ‚Äúslumping‚Äù of land from melting permafrost; the disruption of animal breeding cycles; the appearance of new birds, plants and insects; along with cooler, wetter, foggier, and windier summers caused by the increase in icebergs in local waters from Greenland‚Äôs glaciers. Although she has only lived there since 2001, she said most of these changes have been occurring in Pond Inlet, and elsewhere in the Arctic, for at least 50 years. #witnesstreeproject #environment #nationalparks #climate #climatechange #globalwarming #temperature #parks #world #planet #earth #support #donate #protect #environmentalism #everydayclimatechange
tags: donate, temperature, world, nationalparks, globalwarming, protect, witnesstreeproject, environment, environmentalism, planet, parks, everydayclimatechange, climatechange, climate, support, earth

caption: Tree by the shores of Lake Erie, Cleveland, Ohio, USA, 2010 Warming global temperatures mean less ice in winter and more evaporation in summer on the Great Lakes. The result is declining water levels, a problem for communities who rely on the lakes for fishing, shipping, hydroelectric power, and groundwater resources. Along the shores of Lake Erie in my hometown of Cleveland, Ohio, this ‚Äúwitness tree‚Äù stands sentinel, a bare and fragile beauty threatened by the seemingly maleficent figure rising behind it. This has become a signature image for my project, a symbol of nature‚Äôs fragility in the face of devastating climate change #witnesstreeproject #climatechange #environment #earth #ohio #cleveland #lakeerie #witnesstree #beauty #fragile #globalwarming #change #water #everydayclimatechange
tags: ohio, environment, water, beauty, cleveland, globalwarming, everydayclimatechange, climatechange, fragile, witnesstree, change, witnesstreeproject, earth, lakeerie

caption: Anastasia Mugo planting potatoes, Siaya, Kenya, 2012 In the small village of Siaya in western Kenya, many local residents plant crops for their own family use and to sell for income. Like most farmers in the region they are primarily dependent on rainfall to water their crops, yet climate variability is creating more droughts and flooding. Crop loss, food security, clean water and health issues are some of the major concerns of residents in this area. #witnesstreeproject #kenya #siaya #village #residents #crops #climatechange #globalwarming #humans #environment #water #flood #flooding #health #concerns #people #earth #africa #planet #photography #photo #everydayclimatechange

caption: Forest Service Rangers Ryan Meredith and Mike Rhea Emerald Bay State Park, Tahoe, California, USA, 2104 When I asked these forest rangers what they would miss most if climate change continues unabated, Ryan Meredith answered immediately, ‚Äúskiing.‚Äù He added that in recent years the local ski season has shrunk from several months to just several weeks. #witnesstreeproject #tahoe #california #environment #climate #climatechange #environmental #california #statepark #service #servicerangers #rangers #parkranger #parks #people #everydayclimatechange

caption: #Repost @everydayclimatechange with @repostapp „Éª„Éª„Éª Photo by Amnon Gutman @gutmanen for #everydayclimatechange. Women passing time outside their home in one of the slums of Kampla, during a hot summer day. Uganda is one of the countries that are greatly vulnerable to climate change impacts, in respect of climate variability including increasing temperatures, increased frequency and intensity of rainfall, heat waves, droughts, floods and storms. The regions and ecosystems across the country, like the mountain regions, the lowlands and the cattle corridor, differ in their vulnerability and adaptive capacity. In general the sectors most vulnerable to climate change impacts are agriculture, water supply, health, transport, housing and personal safety and security. The economy and the well being of the people of Uganda are tightly bound to climate, especially because over 80% of the population is rural and depending on rain fed agriculture, that is prone to impacts of climate variability. The climate change and variability in the coming century will inflate the frequency and intensity of extreme weathers events and has the potential to halt or reverse the country‚Äôs development trajectory. In particular this will reveal in increased food insecurity, shift in the spread of diseases like malaria, soil erosion and land degradation followed by landslides, flood damage to infrastructure as well as settlement and in lower productivity of agriculture and natural resources. #climatechange #globalwarming #climatechangeuganda
tags: climatechange, climatechangeuganda, repost, globalwarming, everydayclimatechange

caption: #Repost @everydaymumbai with @repostapp „Éª„Éª„Éª Slums of Mumbai, India. Energy puts on an incredible show at night and reminds you that millions of people are alive, surviving, and going through the daily grind. So much of our energy is sourced from fossil fuels that are responsible for vast amounts of air pollution and CO2 emissions that cause climate change. However, fossil fuels have been and still are responsible for the development of billions of people worldwide. There is no other source of concentrated energy that is so cheap, accessible, and transportable. This is why it is so important that global leaders take into consideration multiple solutions and adaptations to wean our society off our fossil fuel addiction. If people are to be lifted out of poverty, alternative energy sources need to be just as cheap and accessible. Subsidies play a large part in this game, and there is a dire need to shift subsidies away from fossil fuels to clean energy sources. Energy is a central factor to the betterment of people's lives. Without it nothing is possible. . #everydayclimatechange #climatechange #globalwarming #climatechangeisreal #everydaymumbai #everydayindia #mumbai #india Photo @ashleycrowtherorg / @everydayclimatechange
tags: everydaymumbai, repost, globalwarming, everydayclimatechange, climatechange, mumbai, climatechangeisreal, india, everydayindia

caption: Women of a fishing village on Monpura, discuss community issues on the eroded shores of the island. Photo by Paolo Patrizi @paolopatrizi for @everydayclimatechange Bangladesh is sinking. The fertile, lowland country has always been at the whim of the rivers, waves and rains. But as the sea rises due to global climate change, Bangladesh‚Äôs relationship with water is becoming more complicated. Most of the country sits just seven feet above sea level. Over the next forty years almost 17 percent of the country could sink into the sea, leaving 18 million people without a home. #everydayclimatechange #climatechange #globalwarming #climatechangeisreal #everydaybangladesh

caption: Photo By: @jean.jax „Éª„Éª„Éª Ghazipur landfill, in use since 1984, gets over 2,500 metric tonnes of garbage everyday. The facility surpassed its 20 metre capacity over a decade ago. caption: Photo by Georgina Goodwin @ggkenya for @everydayclimatechange. Climbers near Stella Point on Kilimanjaro's rim at sunrise, a view of the vertical margin wall can be seen of what is left of the Rebmann Glacier, a small remnant of what was the enormous icecap which once crowned Mount Kilimanjaro, 14 October 2016. There are many forces driving the climate of East Africa, one being the increased dryness of East Africa - the cause of droughts and famines in Kenya, Ethiopia and Sudan - which may be the key driver of glacier shrinkage and may in fact be speeding up due to global climate change. About 90% of Kilimanjaro's snowcap has vanished, the rate of glacier shrinkage doubling since the 1970s when human caused climate change kicked in. #climatechange #globalwarming #everydayclimatechange #documentary #photojournalism #climate #kilimanjaro #tanzania #environment #desert #desertification #toldwithexposure #visualsoflife #followmetoo #justbackfrom #glaciers #climatechangeisreal @natgeo #reframeclimate #dust #canon #ic_landscapes #canon5dmarkIII #photooftheday . caption: The shallow seas serve as nesting sites for the vulnerable Olive Ridley Turtle. 'We cannot be sure if any turtles have died until we do a postmortem.' Said Shravan Krishnan of Students Sea Turtle Conservation Network. On January 28, 2017, two ships collided outside the Kamarajar Port Ltd in Ennore leading to a massive oil spill that has affected more than 45 km of Chennai‚Äôs coastline. The company‚Äôs first response was to deny any damage to the environment, and it went ahead to ensure that the situation was being monitored by all top officials at the port. The subsequent days proved otherwise. @hindustan_times #chennaioilspill #everydayclimatechange #everydayeverywhere #indiapictures #instagram #reportagespotlight #indiaphotoproject #india_gram #myfeatureshoot #saumyakhandelwalphotos

caption: #Repost @raghavjuyal with @repostapp „Éª„Éª„Éª #Repost @everydayclimatechange „Éª„Éª„Éª Photo by Ashley Crowther @ashleycrowtherorg for @everydayclimatechange: Building new homes in an uncertain future. The village of Kumik in the Zanskar Himalayan range in India‚Äôs north-west has watched their glacier disappear over recent decades from warming temperatures. The ice once upon a time ran right down to the village. These days, as pictured in the background, it has fully retreated and melt water from the ice no longer flows to Kumik. This massive loss of regular water has contributed or arguably is the cause of so many of the village‚Äôs problems. From lowering yields, crop failures, lack of fodder for livestock and increasing political divisions within the village. Water binds all these together. As the globe warms water issues, here and elsewhere in the world, will be one of the most paramount issues that humanity faces and must address and adapt to. A drier planet will most certainly shift the way we have developed our species over thousands of years. #everydayclimatechange #climatechange #globalwarming #asia #india #climatechangeisreal
tags: india, climatechange, globalwarming, asia, climatechangeisreal, repost, everydayclimatechange

caption: #Regram #RG @everydayclimatechange: Photo by Katharina Hesse /@hessekatharina A hazy view of Hebei province near Shijiazhuang in the morning. Two of the most toxic components of smog saw their readings exceed 1,000 on the air quality index in Shijiazhuang in China‚Äôs northern Hebei province late last year, state media reported. One resident said her lungs felt ‚Äúextremely uncomfortable‚Äù after she went walking outside for just a few minutes. The amount of PM2.5 and PM10 recorded in Shijiazhuang was greater than 1,000 micrograms per cubic metre at around 1pm, according to Xinhua. Both are types of suspended respirable particles that pose a risk to human health. The World Health Organisation recommends exposure to PM2.5 be limited to 25 micrograms per cubic metre over 24 hours, and 50 micrograms per cubic metre for PM10. Air pollution usually worsens in northern China during the winter, as coal is used to heat homes. Beijing issued a red alert for smog in mid December 2016, its first of the year, and 10 cities in Hebei have followed suit. Under China‚Äôs four-tiered warning system, a red alert will force suspension of factory production and school classes, as well as traffic reduction measures. In China alone, more than 1.6 million people die annually from air pollution. Heavy coal use has resulted in high carbon emissions. Although China has reduced greenhouse gas emissions by 250,000 tons, the nation continues to emit 25 million tons of greenhouse gases, according to Environment Minister Chen Jining. Enforcement of environmental laws has improved, but slowly, and air pollution continues to be a fact of life in most cities. This has contributed to an accelerated pace of climate change, which has been noticed in the past few years. According to scientists at the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory, temperatures are rising at a faster rate than they have in the past 1,000 years, about 2.5 times as rapidly according to Forbes magazine. #climatechange #Katharinahesse #china. #airpollution #smog #everydayclimatechange #earth #life #evnvironment #environmentalist #ourplanetdaily
tags: climatechange, earth, smog, ourplanetdaily, life, china, regram, environmentalist, katharinahesse, evnvironment, rg, airpollution, everydayclimatechange

caption: The world's attention is increasingly being brought to what is now commonly called global warming, which most scientists say is caused by carbon dioxide and other greenhouse gas emissions largely coming from rich countries. But experts say deforestation in developing countries such as those in Africa also exacerbates the effects of climate change. The country has lost more than 8% of its forest cover since 1963. Today, Kenya is among countries of the world with a forest cover of less than 2% of total land mass. One of the main contributing factors is human activities like logging, cutting for firewood and charcoal burning, and encroachment of forestland all of which continue under the eyes of Kenya Forest Services and other government agencies who do not appreciate the need for a green economy. The government is very much aware of the ongoing deforestation in the country, but with polluted politics, a burgeoning population with 42.4% being children under 15 (according to 2015 census), many of whom live on a less than a dollar a day, the hope to save our forests seems to be fading every day. . . #climatechange #everydayclimatechange @everydayclimatechange #everydayclimatechange #forests #windowtotheworld #trees #poverty #environment #rural #vscokenya #igkenya #childrenoftheworld #makeportraitsnotwar #deforestation #toldwithexposure #visualsoflife #followmetoo #justbackfrom #climatechangeisreal @natgeo #natgeo #reframeclimate #mycanon #canon5dmarkiii
tags: canon5dmarkiii, justbackfrom, poverty, forests, trees, everydayclimatechange, climatechangeisreal, natgeo, deforestation, makeportraitsnotwar, reframeclimate, environment, mycanon, toldwithexposure, windowtotheworld, rural, followmetoo, childrenoftheworld, visualsoflife, igkenya, climatechange, vscokenya

caption: Trees are life. Without them we wouldn't have clear air to breathe. We wouldn't have paper to write beautiful stories and our powerful knowledge down. We wouldn't have fire to warm us when it's cold outside. Without trees we wouldn't be able to exist. But still humans destroy parts of the rain forest that are as big as Greece each and every year. And one of the main reasons is to make space for soy plants to feed to their cattle. By not eating animals you can not only save the animals' life, you can save the trees and in the end your life. Climate change is real and it's happening right now. ‚òÄÔ∏èüå™üåäüåç

Omar, a professional cow milker, at work at the farm where we buy our milk. Morogoro, Tanzania. Due to an exceptional drought hitting Tanzania, cows find less and less nutritious food to eat. Cows such as these usually produce about 16 to 20 liters of milk per day. In the absence of food, milk production goes down to about 5 liters per day, hitting hard on both farmers and the market. #everydayeverywhere #everydayafrica #everydayclimatechange #milker #cowboy #milk #tanzania #morogoro #eastafrica #drought

caption: A fortnight after the Dawn Kanchipuram spilt an estimated 75 tonnes of bunker oil ‚Äî a heavy petroleum residue used to start ship engines ‚Äî port authorities are yet to explain how two enormous tankers, each freighted with inflammable hydrocarbons, could collide three kilometres off the Chennai coastline. On January 28, 2017, two ships collided outside the Kamarajar Port Ltd in Ennore leading to a massive oil spill that has affected more than 45 km of Chennai‚Äôs coastline. The company‚Äôs first response was to deny any damage to the environment, and it went ahead to ensure that the situation was being monitored by all top officials at the port. The subsequent days proved otherwise. @hindustan_times #chennaioilspill #everydayclimatechange #everydayeverywhere #indiapictures #instagram #reportagespotlight #indiaphotoproject #india_gram #myfeatureshoot #saumyakhandelwalphotos

caption: Climate Change in Bangladesh ~ A children lie on the open sky and her mother preparing food at the village of Patharghata the Barguna District area on 21 November 2007 in Bangladesh. Cyclone Sidr, reaching top speeds of almost 240 km per hour, hits the coastal district of Bangladesh, devastating the country's southwest and southern costal areas, including the Sunderbans, and killing thousands. The cyclone leaves its mark of devastation on 130 upazilas, 710 unions, affecting almost 3 million people. Climate Change is my long-term project where I began to document of marginal condition in my own country of Bangladesh. My investigation finally brought me to a climate refugee in Bangladesh.¬© Monirul Alam ¬© Monirul Alam #climatechange#globalwarming#everydayclimatechange#photojournalism#bangladesh#dailylife#erosion#drought#flood#yourshotphotographer#reportagespotlight#opensocietyfoundations#lensculture#longtermproject#documentary#CycloneSidr#food#disaster#villager

caption: A severe front approaches the outback city of Kalgoorlie-Boulder, Western Australia 10.02.17 . While large parts of Australia's eastern states are experiencing record high temperatures and catastrophic bushfire risks, Western Australian rain records have been smashed, causing widespread flooding, damage to property and, tragically, loss of life. As our climate changes, these weather events are predicted to become more frequent and extreme. #climate #climatechange #everydayclimatechange #storm #squall #australianlife #documentary #thisiswa #australia #nikon #kalgoorlie #everydayaustralia #landscape #outback #desert #westernaustralia #clouds #cloudporn

caption: I've been in and fought a few bushfires in the past and more recently photographed a few. (Crowdy Bay Bushfire pictured) Today is extreme at 46degC here on the coast this afternoon with properties at risk from extreme conditions and fires about 30kms inland. The smoke is drifting overhead and out to sea with winds expected to pickup with a southerly change. Its like a hot furnace outside and we can only hope conditions don't get worse for those in the affected areas. #bushfire #everydayclimatechange #canonaustralia
tags: everydayclimatechange, bushfire, canonaustralia

caption: Skinning up to the Shark's Fin behind Mt Apharwat peak at 4200m. This January the Gulmarg area received record snowfall. The last two Januarys however have been very warm and dry. The winter season for tourism has been shrinking annually and now only has reliable skiing for about 2 months. A study by Kashmir University predicts winter tourism (the only source of winter employment) may only be sustainable for ten more years. #EverydayClimateChange #ProtectOurWinters #Skiing #India #Kashmir #Gulmarg #SharksFin #EarnYourTurns #SkiTouring #SeekingBalanceFindingAdventure

caption: Bunker oil, or fuel oil, of the sort spilt by one of the ships in question, the Kanchipuram, is a thick viscous mix of highly toxic polyaromatic hydrocarbons that impact the pulmonary, digestive, renal and dermal systems of all living beings. It affects nearly every vital organ. Along the shore, the oil mixes with sand and debris to form a thick viscous sludge that gradually oxidizes into a toxic brown mass that experts like to call ‚Äúchocolate mousse‚Äù. On January 28, 2017, two ships collided outside the Kamarajar Port Ltd in Ennore leading to a massive oil spill that has affected more than 45 km of Chennai‚Äôs coastline. The company‚Äôs first response was to deny any damage to the environment, and it went ahead to ensure that the situation was being monitored by all top officials at the port. The subsequent days proved otherwise. @hindustan_times #chennaioilspill #everydayclimatechange #everydayeverywhere #indiapictures #instagram #reportagespotlight #indiaphotoproject #india_gram #myfeatureshoot #saumyakhandelwalphotos

caption: Sonora, 2008. Muro fronterizo en el sector del Desierto de Sonora entre Sonoyta y San Luis R√≠o Colorado. Desde tierra mexicana, un soldado estadounidense jala una de las placas met√°licas durante el ensamblado del muro fronterizo. Este sector del desierto se ubica en el lado norte de la "Reserva de la bi√≥sfera El Pinacate y Gran Desierto de Altar", la cual cuenta con especies end√©micas y en peligro de extinci√≥n como el berrendo de Sonora, el borrego cimarr√≥n, el monstruo de Gila y la tortuga de desierto. caption: On January 28, 2017, two ships collided outside the Kamarajar Port Ltd in Ennore leading to a massive oil spill that has affected more than 45 km of Chennai‚Äôs coastline. The company‚Äôs first response was to deny any damage to the environment, and it went ahead to ensure that the situation was being monitored by all top officials at the port. The subsequent days proved otherwise. Fourteen days later, we know that the sludge stands at 75 tonnes and is the cause of death of more than 40 endangered olive ridley turtles. The business of the local fishermen communities have been majorly affected as the sales of fish plummeted. The toxic sludge which can still be seen in portions along the coast can have major health and ecological hazards whose affect will only be know in the coming months. @hindustan_times #chennaioilspill #everydayclimatechange #everydayeverywhere #indiapictures #instagram #reportagespotlight #indiaphotoproject #india_gram #myfeatureshoot #saumyakhandelwalphotos
tags: everydayeverywhere, reportagespotlight, saumyakhandelwalphotos, myfeatureshoot, chennaioilspill, indiaphotoproject, india_gram, everydayclimatechange, indiapictures, instagram

caption: El #CambioClim√°tico afecta y afectar√° a todos y todo. Una de las consecuencias que ya se est√° observando ... hielos se derriten y con ello sube nivel del mar // @Regrann from @everydayclimatechange - Guest Post: Photo by Sean T. Smith @stsphotovideo for @everydayclimatechange Glaciar (Glacier) Perito Moreno, El Calafate- Argentina. This glacial calving event may be a small drop in a big bucket, but carries an ominous feeling. Current CO2 levels have surpassed the recommended 350ppm levels and have broken into the uncharted 400ppm range, making it harder to believe global temperatures will stay within a sustainable 2¬∫C. The debate shouldn't be about whether climate change is happening, it should be about the various ways to take action and address it. Note from @everydayclimatechange: Perito Moreno Glacier is one of two glaciers in Patagonia that are actually advancing, not receding. Scientists are not sure but think it may have something to do with how steep the glacier is at the equilibrium line, the spot that divides where the glacier is building versus where more ice melts than accumulates. Still, on balance, Patagonia‚Äôs glaciers are receding because of climate change, contributing to sea rise. #patagonia #optoutside #climatechange #sonyalpha #sonya7r2 #argentina #everydayclimatechange #globalwarming #ice #water - #regrann
tags: water, sonya7r2, regrann, ice, sonyalpha, optoutside, everydayclimatechange, globalwarming, climatechange, cambioclim√°tico, patagonia, argentina

caption: #Repost @leonardodicaprio with @repostapp „Éª„Éª„Éª #Regram #RG @everydayclimatechange: Photo by Katharina Hesse /@hessekatharina A hazy view of Hebei province near Shijiazhuang in the morning. Two of the most toxic components of smog saw their readings exceed 1,000 on the air quality index in Shijiazhuang in China‚Äôs northern Hebei province late last year, state media reported. One resident said her lungs felt ‚Äúextremely uncomfortable‚Äù after she went walking outside for just a few minutes. The amount of PM2.5 and PM10 recorded in Shijiazhuang was greater than 1,000 micrograms per cubic metre at around 1pm, according to Xinhua. Both are types of suspended respirable particles that pose a risk to human health. The World Health Organisation recommends exposure to PM2.5 be limited to 25 micrograms per cubic metre over 24 hours, and 50 micrograms per cubic metre for PM10. Air pollution usually worsens in northern China during the winter, as coal is used to heat homes. Beijing issued a red alert for smog in mid December 2016, its first of the year, and 10 cities in Hebei have followed suit. Under China‚Äôs four-tiered warning system, a red alert will force suspension of factory production and school classes, as well as traffic reduction measures. In China alone, more than 1.6 million people die annually from air pollution. Heavy coal use has resulted in high carbon emissions. Although China has reduced greenhouse gas emissions by 250,000 tons, the nation continues to emit 25 million tons of greenhouse gases, according to Environment Minister Chen Jining. Enforcement of environmental laws has improved, but slowly, and air pollution continues to be a fact of life in most cities. This has contributed to an accelerated pace of climate change, which has been noticed in the past few years. According to scientists at the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory, temperatures are rising at a faster rate than they have in the past 1,000 years, about 2.5 times as rapidly according to Forbes magazine. #climatechange #Katharinahesse #china. #airpollution #smog #everydayclimatechange
tags: üò∑, solar, savetheearth, katharinahesse, asthma, climatechangeisreal, coalisnotclean, airpollution, wind, china, everydayclimatechange, smog, climatechange, repost, regram, rg

caption: Building new homes in an uncertain future. The village of Kumik in the Zanskar Himalayan range in India‚Äôs north-west has watched their glacier disappear over recent decades from warming temperatures. The ice once upon a time ran right down to the village. These days, as pictured in the background, it has fully retreated and melt water from the ice no longer flows to Kumik. This massive loss of regular water has contributed or arguably is the cause of so many of the village‚Äôs problems. From lowering yields, crop failures, lack of fodder for livestock and increasing political divisions within the village. Water binds all these together. As the globe warms water issues, here and elsewhere in the world, will be one of the most paramount issues that humanity faces and must address and adapt to. A drier planet will most certainly shift the way we have developed our species over thousands of years. #everydayclimatechange #climatechange #globalwarming #asia #india #climatechangeisreal
tags: everydayclimatechange, globalwarming, climatechange, asia, india, climatechangeisreal

The World Health Organisation recommends exposure to PM2.5 be limited to 25 micrograms per cubic metre over 24 hours, and 50 micrograms per cubic metre for PM10. Air pollution usually worsens in northern China during the winter, as coal is used to heat homes. Beijing issued a red alert for smog in mid December 2016, its first of the year, and 10 cities in Hebei have followed suit. Under China‚Äôs four-tiered warning system, a red alert will force suspension of factory production and school classes, as well as traffic reduction measures. In China alone, more than 1.6 million people die annually from air pollution. Heavy coal use has resulted in high carbon emissions. Although China has reduced greenhouse gas emissions by 250,000 tons, the nation continues to emit 25 million tons of greenhouse gases, according to Environment Minister Chen Jining. Enforcement of environmental laws has improved, but slowly, and air pollution continues to be a fact of life in most cities. This has contributed to an accelerated pace of climate change, which has been noticed in the past few years. According to scientists at the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory, temperatures are rising at a faster rate than they have in the past 1,000 years, about 2.5 times as rapidly according to Forbes magazine. #climatechange #Katharinahesse #china. #airpollution #smog #everydayclimatechange
tags: airpollution, china, katharinahesse, climatechange, pollution, regram, everydayclimatechange, rg, smog

caption: "Rise in the water levels during floods corrodes the foundation of our houses which demand constant repair. It's a huge expense on our pockets". This photo-series is from the Slums of Mattakkuliya (Colombo), following the floods that struck Srilanka in 2016. Beginning on 14 May 2016, a low pressure area over the Bay of Bengal caused torrential rain to fall across Sri Lanka, causing floods and landslides which affected half a million people. Slums of Mattakuliya houses communities right on the edge of the Kelani river. Consisting of jam packed, unplanned improvised and semi-permanent housing constructions, living right on the edge of the river. Most of the people living here are poor, and work on daily basis. Following the heavy rains and floods of May, homeowners had to evacuate when water entered their houses. Leaving these poor people with flooded basements, costly roof repairs and damaged electrical appliances. Photo by @munazzaanwaar #Srilanka #Floods #flooding #ClimateChange #globalwarming #environment #climate #climatefacts #photojournalism #everydayeverywhere #everydayclimatechange #climateaction
tags: srilanka, everydayeverywhere, floods, climate, environment, climatechange, climatefacts, everydayclimatechange, photojournalism, globalwarming, flooding, climateaction
