caption: This is another satellite image of the - Molai Forest - in Kokilamukh, Jorhat district, Assam, India. This is a huge regeneration effort and more impressively, it has been carried out by one single individual, Mr. Jadav "Molai" Payeng. His forest is now so large that as these satellite images show, it can be seen from orbit. According to my calculations, through his afforestation efforts, Mr. Payeng could have easily sequestered 220,000 metric tons of CO‚ÇÇ from the atmosphere, which would make him one of the persons with the largest negative carbon balances in history. For anyone who, like Mr. Payeng, is interested in offsetting their own historical cumulative individual or corporate emissions of greenhouse gases and becoming #carbonneutral or #carbonnegative , projects like ‚Äì greening Las Vegas ‚Äì would be ideal. ‚Äì greening Las Vegas ‚Äì would be designed to sustainably and productively regenerate 8+ hectares of permanent desert in the metropolitan area of Las Vegas into a self sustaining and self sufficient forest ecosystem as well as permanently sequester 4,000 MT of CO‚ÇÇ while producing tens of tons of superior quality food. All contributors to our #crowdfunding #campaign will receive proportional carbon credit according to their donations. This will give them access to the most effective and efficient method to begin offsetting their historical cumulative greenhouse gases emissions with, which is the most effective strategy any individual or corporation can follow to collaborate in helping solve global anthropogenic climate disruption. The link to our #indiegogo campaign can be found on the biography section of this profile. https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/greening-las-vegas--2/ #ecosystemregenerationworldwide #ecosystemregeneration #greeninglasvegas #ecosystemrestoration #afforestation #love #amazing #smile #look #happy #JadavPayeng #permaculture #sustainability #climatechange #everydayclimatechange #actonclimate #globalwarming #regeneration #ecology #environment #greenpeace #green #dogood #conservation #sustainable
tags: sustainability, sustainable, environment, crowdfunding, permaculture, afforestation, happy, amazing, green, indiegogo, carbonneutral, ecosystemrestoration, everydayclimatechange, jadavpayeng, ecology, actonclimate, smile, climatechange, greeninglasvegas, dogood, ecosystemregeneration, look, regeneration, globalwarming, greenpeace, conservation, carbonnegative, campaign, love, ecosystemregenerationworldwide

caption: This is a satellite image of the - Molai Forest -, an area of 550 hectares in the Majuli island in Kokilamukh, Jorhat district, Assam, India, that a local man, Jadav "Molai" Payeng has afforested all by himself. Mr. Payeng achieved this over more than 30 years of hard manual labor, he didn't need any capital or formal education but was successful in transforming this island from barren sandbar to a diverse forest biome. Just for reference, Molai Forest is much bigger than the most notorious mega squares in the world, as Tiananmen square has an area of 44 hectares, the Red Square in Moskva (–∫—Ä–∞ÃÅ—Å–Ω–∞—è –ø–ª–æÃÅ—â–∞–¥—å –ú–æ—Å–∫–≤–∞) an area of 23 hectares and the largest paved public square in the world, the Pra√ßa dos Girass√≥is in the state of Tocantins in Brasil has an area of 57 hectares. Molai Forest is also famously larger than Central Park in Manhattan which has an area of 340 hectares. #ecosystemregenerationworldwide #ecosystemregeneration #greeninglasvegas #ecosystemrestoration #afforestation #love #amazing #smile #look #happy #JadavPayeng #permaculture #sustainability #climatechange #everydayclimatechange #actonclimate #globalwarming #regeneration #ecology #carbonnegative #environment #greenpeace #green #dogood #conservation #sustainable

caption: #Repost @everydayclimatechange with @repostapp „Éª„Éª„Éª Photo by Vlad Sokhin @lens_pacific for @everydayclimatechange Nathan Tom, 32, holds a scull of musk ox near his house in Newtok village, Alaska. Nathan's house will be the first to disappear due coastal erosion. Nathan says that every year the villagers put pegs into the ground several dozen meters from the cliff. Almost every year the pegs collapse into the ground due to erosion. This year the peg was hammered in Nathan's backyard. He says: 'A couple years from now, I will have to leave this house. It's good that our village has already started relocating to a new place where we won't have these problems.' Surrounded by water, Newtok village is under imminent threat from climate change. Permafrost thaw, regular floods and coastal erosion make it dangerous for people of Newtok to remain there. It is estimated that in the next ten years nearly a 1/3 of the village's area will become uninhabitable due to erosion. #Alaska #Newtok #climatechange #everydayclimatechange #unitedstates #usa #America #globalwarming #climatechangeisreal @panospictures
tags: alaska, usa, globalwarming, unitedstates, climatechange, newtok, repost, climatechangeisreal, everydayclimatechange, america

caption: Gran retrato realizado por mi gran amigo @adrianactitud a petici√≥n mia jajaja. @Regrann from @adrianactitud - La tarde de ayer sal√≠ con dos viejos amigos a hacer fotos por Altamira y Chacao, nos encontramos a eso de las 4:00-4:30pm. En un instante de charla y risa se hicieron las 5:30pm y r√°pido comenzamos a caminar e hicimos el recorrido. Yo como cosa rara no me llev√© mi c√°mara, pero estaba usando de a momentos la de mi amigo Kremlin que a el disparar fotos yo ve√≠a algo interesante y de inmediato se la ped√≠a (muchas veces coincidimos con la misma foto pero de un diferente √°ngulo. Esto creo que sucede muy a menudo cuando sales con un compa√±ero fot√≥grafo) jajaja bueno, contin√∫o... Caminando a cortos pasos el me pide que le haga una foto, en ese momento se reflejaba un atardecer muy bonito de fondo el cual yo vi pero no me llam√≥ tanto la atenci√≥n como a √©l sin embargo el posa y yo disparo, la foto obviamente sale en contraluz pero yo acciono el flash de la c√°mara (esto es algo que uso o hago pocas veces, pero que suele ayudar bastante.) al disparar nuevamente veo la foto y al instante mi visi√≥n se pone en Blanco y Negro, no me import√≥ en ese momento el "atardecer" simplemente vi en Blanco y negro. Mi amigo Kremlin la vio y me dice que le gustaron y que me las enviar√≠a a penas llegue a su casa para que yo las revele. Asi fue, en la noche me las pasa pero yo estaba muy cansado y fue hasta hoy que pude descargarlas para verlas. Cuando las descargo y abro en Lightroom (programa de edici√≥n de fotos) la edito y la pongo en blanco y negro digo "WOW! Lo sabia, esta es la foto." Y aqui esta, un retrato a un buen amigo en la ciudad de Caracas un 2 de Enero de 2017. Espero la disfruten. caption: Destruction of Brazil's Amazon rainforest is playing a significant role in the impacts and pace of climate change. While there are many contributing factors to the deforestation - hydropower development, mining, timber production - by far the largest pressure is the expansion of agriculture. The Amazon rainforest is one of Earth‚Äôs great carbon banks; it acts as a giant sponge, absorbing billions of metric tons of carbon dioxide per year, though that number has decreased by a third over the past decade according to a 2015 University of Leeds study. In this photo, smoke reveals a single tree as a fire burns the Amazon rainforest, clearing the way for agriculture in Sao Felix Do Xingu municipality, Para State, Brazil, 2008. #amazonrainforest #globalwarming #climatechange #deforestation #everydayclimatechange #amazonforest #brazilenvironment #amazondeforestation #amazon

caption: Is it possible to green the desert and regenerate permanent deserts productively and sustainably? Well, just watch for yourself. This is a composite image of photographs that document how before 4 years it was possible to transform half a hectare of completely barren land for a regeneration project in Jordan (even when it suffered from significant underfunding). This location in the Jordan Valley region has served as a demonstration site for many of the techniques that would be used to an even more potent effect for the ‚Äì greening Las Vegas ‚Äì project. ‚Äì greening Las Vegas ‚Äì would be designed to sustainably and productively regenerate 8+ hectares of permanent desert in the metropolitan area of Las Vegas into a self sustaining and self sufficient forest ecosystem as well as permanently sequester 4,000 MT of CO‚ÇÇ while producing tens of tons of superior quality food. All contributors to our #crowdfunding #campaign will receive proportional carbon credit according to their donations. This will give them access to the most effective and efficient method to begin offsetting their historical cumulative greenhouse gases emissions with, which is the most effective strategy any individual or corporation can follow to collaborate in helping solve global anthropogenic climate disruption. The link to our #indiegogo campaign can be found on the biography section of this profile. https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/greening-las-vegas--2/ #ecosystemregenerationworldwide #ecosystemregeneration #greeninglasvegas #ecosystemrestoration #afforestation #love #amazing #smile #look #happy #jordan #permaculture #sustainability #climatechange #everydayclimatechange #actonclimate #globalwarming #regeneration #ecology #carbonnegative #environment #greenpeace #green #dogood #conservation #sustainable
tags: look, greenpeace, afforestation, regeneration, smile, sustainability, carbonnegative, globalwarming, crowdfunding, greeninglasvegas, happy, ecosystemregeneration, amazing, ecosystemregenerationworldwide, permaculture, everydayclimatechange, ecosystemrestoration, dogood, green, sustainable, climatechange, indiegogo, jordan, ecology, love, environment, conservation, campaign, actonclimate

caption: This image with two photographs of the Jordan Valley regeneration project captures the striking difference in the landscape before and after the regeneration techniques were applied, as the plot that has been worked on has been transformed into a veritable forest while all the surrounding areas remain as barren and extremely degraded as they were initially. This kind of regeneration transformations are both productive and sustainably as they do not depend at all on agrochemicals, mechanized irrigation or agricultural machinery. ‚Äì greening Las Vegas ‚Äì would be designed to be more than ten times bigger than this project and also more productive, permanently sequestering 4,000 MT of CO‚ÇÇ while producing tens of tons of superior quality food. All contributors to our #crowdfunding #campaign will receive proportional carbon credit according to their donations. This will give them access to the most effective and efficient method to begin offsetting their historical cumulative greenhouse gases emissions with, which is the most effective strategy any individual or corporation can follow to collaborate in helping solve global anthropogenic climate disruption. The link to our #indiegogo campaign can be found on the biography section of this profile. https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/greening-las-vegas--2/ #ecosystemregenerationworldwide #ecosystemregeneration #greeninglasvegas #ecosystemrestoration #afforestation #love #amazing #smile #look #happy #jordan #permaculture #sustainability #climatechange #everydayclimatechange #actonclimate #globalwarming #regeneration #ecology #carbonnegative #environment #greenpeace #green #dogood #conservation #sustainable

caption: "L'ali√©e" - 2016‚†Ä Marbre noir Golzinne / M√©tal‚†Ä Black marble Golzinne / Metal‚†Ä ‚†Ä ‚†Ä "Quelle ironie que de vivre √† l‚Äôombre de ce monde du vivant sur lequel nous nous asseyons et dont nous mangeons les fruits, au branches duquel nous sommes agripp√©s et arrosons les racines; et pour lequel la plupart d‚Äôentre nous, ont rarement ne serait-ce qu‚Äôune pens√©e et comprennent si mal. Nous avons besoin de parvenir, d√®s que possible, √† une profonde compr√©hension et appr√©cier les arbres et des for√™ts et le r√¥le vital qu‚Äôils jouent, car ils sont parmi nos meilleurs alli√©s dans cet avenir incertain qui se d√©roule."‚†Ä ‚†Ä "How ironical it is to live in the shade of this living world, to sit on it and eat its fruit, to hang down to its branches and water its roots ; most of us never, or rarely, give it a thought or understand it properly. As soon as possible, we need to understand and enjoy thoroughly the trees and forests, as well as their vital role, because they are our best allies in order to face the unsteady oncoming future."‚†Ä ‚†Ä (Jim Robbins)‚†Ä ‚†Ä #art#sculpture#artist#fineart#marbre#marble#marmo#ecology#ecologie#artcontemporain#contemporaryart#art#artwork#artlovers#sculptor#savoirfaire#handmade#climatechange#everydayclimatechange#tree#arbre

caption: @sanjitdas caught me instagramming in the Bauxite mines in the east coast on Malaysia. When bauxite is extracted from the earth, the strip-mining process removes all native vegetation in the mining region, resulting in a loss of habitat and food for local wildlife as well as significant soil erosion. The caustic red sludge and toxic mine tailings that remain are commonly deposited into excavated mine pits where they ultimately seep into aquifers, contaminating local water sources. Greenhouse gas emissions released during smelting and processing (which have been found to blanket surrounding regions with toxic vapors) include carbon dioxide, perfluorocarbons, sodium fluoride, sulfur dioxide, polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon and a vast list of other problematic elements. Particulates released during processing that are known to compromise air quality include combustion byproducts, caustic aerosols, dust from bauxite, limestone, charred lime, alumina and sodium salt. - See more at: http://recyclenation.com/2010/11/aluminum-extraction-recycling-environment#sthash.4OKaEYsQ.dpuf #bauxite #mining #instagramer #onassignment #documentaryphotography #environmentalist #globalwarming #climatechangeisreal #climatechange #everydayasia #everydayclimatechange #azdarya #saveearth #malaysia #wotancraft
tags: wotansday, azdarya, environmentalist, mining, wotancraft, documentaryphotography, globalwarming, onassignment, climatechangeisreal, saveearth, malaysia, everydayclimatechange, sthash, climatechange, bauxite, instagramer, everydayasia

caption: Fatuma Yussuf Ali, 30, poses for a portrait outside Ifo, Dadaab's oldest camp, on the Kenya-Somali border. Along with 115,000 other refugees in 2011 Fatima left southern Somalia for Kenya's Dadaab refugee camp due to conflict and drought. Dadaab was opened in 1991 as a temporary shelter for people fleeing civil war in neighbouring Somalia, yet due to prolonged violence, insecurity and drought it is now a sprawling tent city and the world‚Äôs largest refugee camp with 464,000 registered refugees. In May 2016 the Kenya Government announced closure of the camp and removal of all Somali refugees by the end of the year claiming the Dadaab camp acts as "a terrorist training ground" for al-Shabab fighters. With no options to stay despite the camp's closure delayed by 6 months, many refugees have begun returning to Somalia, a country still struggling to meet basic food needs due to conflict and ongoing drought which have hiked food and water prices causing deterioration in food access and nutritional status. This series of portraits were taken on assignment for Norwegian Refugee Council during research on refugees and climate change. 29 May 2012. #climatechange #globalwarming #everydayclimatechange @everydayclimatechange #photojournalism #climate #somalia #conflict #environment #desertification #portrait #toldwithexposure #visualsoflife #portraitphotography #canon #water #canon5dmarkIII #climatechangeisreal #canon_photos #foodsecurity #africa #lenscultureportraits

caption: I am the Ocean I am water I am most of this planet I shaped it Every stream, every cloud, and every raindrop It all comes back to me. caption: The word 'documentary' would usually bring to mind the concept of a film, moving images, like a David Attenborough's Planet Earth üåè. My interpretation of documenting a situation or event is through still images. Capturing the moments, fractions of time as they occur, unscripted unrehearsed through my lens. Detailed, intimate and revealing. ‚ûï SEALEVEL - The Art of Awareness is my documentation of one of the most major events to effect planet earth in our lifetime. This collection of images is a storytelling journey, my commitment to bringing awareness through the beauty of art. There's an entire gallery to experience online (link in bio) @tedgrambeau #TedGrambeauGallery ‚ûï www.tedgrambeauphotography.com
tags: tedgrambeaugallery

caption: Here, at the edge of the Ganges delta, water intrudes on the low-lying land, and shallow ponds and rivulets proliferate across the landscape. Tidal flooding, inundation by storm surges, saltwater intrusion, and the movement of saline ground water has caused a rise in salinity in the groundwater and the fresh-water ponds. As a result, in the coastal area of Satkhira, potable water is a scarce and precious commodity. My series for @groundtruth explores the impact of this drinking water crisis on the women who are left behind. Link in bio. #ClimateChange #EverydayClimateChange #Bangladesh #Asia #Photojournalism #ClimateJustice #Climatechangemigration #women #gender #water #drinkingwatercrisis
tags: photojournalism, climatejustice, climatechangemigration, women, bangladesh, gender, asia, drinkingwatercrisis, climatechange, everydayclimatechange, water

caption: "Seul" - 2016 Petite pens√©e pour ses propri√©taires br√©siliens. I don't forget its owners from Brazil. "Il se dressait, superbement, sous le ciel bleu, il semblait habit√© par un million d'√¢mes qui doucement chantaient en son branchage creux. J'allais vers lui les yeux emplis par la lumi√®re, je le touchais, avec mes doigts, avec mes mains. Je le sentais bouger jusqu'au fond de la terre d'apr√®s un mouvement √©norme et surhumain ; Et J'appuyais sur lui ma poitrine brutale, avec un tel amour, une telle ferveur, que son rythme profond et sa force totale passaient en moi et p√©n√©traient jusqu'√† mon c≈ìur." "Standing superbly under the blue sky, it seemed inhabited by a million souls singing softly among the hollow branches. I went up to it, my eyes full of light, touching it with my fingers, my hands. I felt it move down to the bottom of the earth after a huge and superhuman movement. And I pressed on it my brutal chest with such love, such fervour that its deep rythm and its total force entered my body and reached my heart." (√âmile VERHAEREN) #art#marbre#marble#marmo#sculpture#artist#fineart#devellopementdurable#durabledevelopment#ecology#ecologie#artcontemporain#contemporaryart#art#artwork#artlovers#sculptor#savoirfaire#handmade#climatechange#everydayclimatechange#brazil#obrigado

caption: Finally getting a chance to look at some cards i hadn't downloaded yet from #Indonesia and this place in Sumatra was the most alarming real life #ferngully situation that still gives me nightmares bc it's not a picture of the #jungle I love. This is a pic of the hours of palm oil fields we drove through for which the jungle was clear cut or burned. Only 25% of the Indonesian rainforest remains and experts say it could completely disappear by 2022 and that's so soon! Palm oil is weirdly in most ice creams and chips and cookies and soda pops and soaps and shampoos and cleaning products and condiments and makeups we use every day so lets all maybe do our best to read our ingredients and try to avoid palm oil, vegetable oil, palmate, sodium laureth sulphate, cetly alcohol, and palminate so that the jungle and all the magical animals that live there still exist in the next decade. Love, Jennie #everydayclimatechange
tags: ferngully, everydayclimatechange, indonesia, jungle

caption: @natgeo | Photo by @edkashi/@viiphoto A field of crops is covered by plastic bags in California‚Äôs Central Valley in December 2016. Prolonged droughts in the Valley have caused extreme weather conditions, damaging crops due to lack of rainfall and absence of moisture in the air. In a recent article posted in cropinsuranceinamerica.org, Doug Benik, a farmer and crop insurance agent explains, ‚ÄúThe lack of moisture in the air allows air temperatures to get much colder in the winter and much hotter in the summer.‚Äù Due to the much colder temperatures, farmers use different methods for protecting their crops from frostbite, such as covering them with bags. #EverydayClimateChange #ActOnClimate #California #CentralValley #Crops #ClimateChange
tags: actonclimate, centralvalley, climatechange, california, crops, everydayclimatechange

caption: #Repost @groundtruth with @repostapp „Éª„Éª„Éª Shahina Begum, a Bangladeshi 18-year-old, moved to Kochukhali village in Bangladesh when she got married at the age of 12. While her husband is away most of the year in Dhaka, she lives with his parents who keep strict tabs on her whereabouts. Socio-cultural norms place limitations on the movement of women outside their houses. While some simply feel uncomfortable navigating the village‚Äôs public spaces, visiting doctors, buying groceries or visiting their children‚Äôs schools, others are bound by the restrictions placed on them by their husband‚Äôs families. üì∑ @nehanotes ... #ClimateChange #EverydayClimateChange #Bangladesh #Asia #Photography #Photojournalism #ClimateJustice #waterislifeüíß

caption: This is Earth. I based this drawing on a photo that was taken in 1972: it was the first photo where Earth was shown in full light, as the camera had been placed directly between the Sun and the Earth. The picture caused a wide realisation among people. They realised, that this blue marble (how the picture was named) is really all we've got. The natural resources are not limitless.üåç New Year offers a good opportunity to stop for a minute, gather your thoughts and maybe make some changes in your life. I made this drawing so you besides myself would think about Earth this year. üòÉ Happy new year 2017!üí´üíö ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ Technique: coloured pencils + white gel pen Time: 16 hours ‚Ä¢‚Ä¢‚Ä¢ #Earth #2017 #newyear #climatechange #artfido #worldofartists #worldofpencils #arts_help #art_collective #art_spotlight #artistuniversity #art_empire #dailyarts #artscrowds #art_worldly #everydayclimatechange

caption: #Repost @everydayclimatechange with @repostapp „Éª„Éª„Éª Photo by James Whitlow Delano @jameswhitlowdelano for @everydayclimatechange To open the New Year from Tokyo, a manifesto of sorts quoting Walt Whitman: This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing...go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul and your very flesh shall be a great poem... Pastoralist walks back to town with her staff in hand as the mountains give way to a landscape reminiscent of a green version of the American Southwest but higher in elevation. Life is hard in the Northern Ethiopian Highlands and heavily dependent on the seasonal rains, which are heavier than usual after the worst drought in decades. Climate change has led aid organizations to fear that this region which already has a high to extreme risk of food insecurity will have intensified food insecurity in the years ahead. #climatechange #globalwarming #drought #floods #africa #ethiopia #ethiopiahighlands #foodinsecurity #everydayclimatechange
tags: floods, climatechange, africa, ethiopia, foodinsecurity, ethiopiahighlands, everydayclimatechange, repost, globalwarming, drought

caption: Golden glow of the christmas lights shimmer through the smog caused by the aftermath of last night's chaos. When I got up the skyscraper, the air was cold and humid, then slowly it turned warm and dry because the firecraker residues spewing all over the sky. Celebrating like this is not helping our environment to improve. We need a safer celebration next year for our one and only planet to live. Make this a resolution this 2017. #philippines #everydayphilippines #everydayeverywhere #WHPresolutions #newyear2017 #smog #everydayclimatechange
tags: philippines, smog, newyear2017, everydayphilippines, whpresolutions, everydayeverywhere, everydayclimatechange

Two women are silhouetted as they walk past a burning bush in Awasi village, Soroti, located in eastern Uganda. Soroti is going through an uncharacteristic climate variation in recent times. While extreme temperatures are normal in this part of the country, most of 2016 had an extended dry season. As a result, farmer's plans were disrupted, crops dried up, animals continue to feed less because of limited pastures. The projections aren't healthy either. A continuation of the current prolonged drought is expected to cause more damage. Already, government has warned of an impending food shortage in Soroti and the surrounding districts, asking people to plan carefully. Photo by @edward_echwalu #Everydayclimatechange #Soroti #Drought #Teso #Uganda
tags: drought, uganda, teso, soroti, everydayclimatechange

caption: To open the New Year from Tokyo, a manifesto of sorts quoting Walt Whitman: This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing...go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul and your very flesh shall be a great poem... Pastoralist walks back to town with her staff in hand as the mountains give way to a landscape reminiscent of a green version of the American Southwest but higher in elevation. Life is hard in the Northern Ethiopian Highlands and heavily dependent on the seasonal rains, which are heavier than usual after the worst drought in decades. Climate change has led aid organizations to fear that this region which already has a high to extreme risk of food insecurity will have intensified food insecurity in the years ahead. #climatechange #globalwarming #drought #floods #africa #ethiopia #ethiopiahighlands #foodinsecurity #everydayclimatechange
tags: climatechange, ethiopia, globalwarming, ethiopiahighlands, foodinsecurity, everydayclimatechange, drought, floods, africa

caption: Shahina Begum, a Bangladeshi 18-year-old, moved to Kochukhali village in Bangladesh when she got married at the age of 12. While her husband is away most of the year in Dhaka, she lives with his parents who keep strict tabs on her whereabouts. Socio-cultural norms place limitations on the movement of women outside their houses. While some simply feel uncomfortable navigating the village‚Äôs public spaces, visiting doctors, buying groceries or visiting their children‚Äôs schools, others are bound by the restrictions placed on them by their husband‚Äôs families. üì∑ @nehanotes ... #ClimateChange #EverydayClimateChange #Bangladesh #Asia #Photography #Photojournalism #ClimateJustice #waterislifeüíß

caption: regram @leonardodicaprio #Regram #RG @natgeo: Photo by @edkashi/@viiphoto: A field of crops is covered by plastic bags in California‚Äôs Central Valley in December 2016. Prolonged droughts in the Valley have caused extreme weather conditions, damaging crops due to lack of rainfall and absence of moisture in the air. In a recent article posted in cropinsuranceinamerica.org, Doug Benik, a farmer and crop insurance agent explains, ‚ÄúThe lack of moisture in the air allows air temperatures to get much colder in the winter and much hotter in the summer.‚Äù Due to the much colder temperatures, farmers use different methods for protecting their crops from frostbite, such as covering them with bags. #everydayclimatechange #actonclimate #California #CentralValley #crops #climatechange .

caption: Welcome 2k17 with a warm thought! #regram #everydayclimatechange An angry sea continues attempting to reclaim the coastline in Pondicherry despite a boulder sea wall built after the 2004 Asian Tsunami. Pondicherry, India. It is not the seismically-induced tsunami, however, the poses the ongoing threat to the coastlines of Pondicherry and Tamil Nadu, which surrounds this former-French enclave. Climate change-induced sea rise and more intense cyclones that warmer sea waters regularly unleash on this coast means that many coastal villages are beginning to pull back from the sea as homes are undermined by eroded beaches. #awarenessissue #cycloneeffect #beforethefloods #dicaprio #think #welcome2k17 #futureisourown #protectit
tags: protectit, futureisourown, awarenessissue, everydayclimatechange, cycloneeffect, beforethefloods, dicaprio, regram, think, welcome2k17
